```{r}
set.seed(123)
x1 <- c(1,1,1,1)
x2 <- c(2,2,4,5)
x3 <- c(3,4,5,1)
y <- c(4,7,9,11)
data_perfect <- data.frame(x1,x2,x3,y)
model_perfect <- lm(y ~ x1 + x2 + x3, data = data_perfect)
summary(model_perfect)



set.seed(123)

# Create a dataset with perfect multicollinearity
x1 <- c(1, 2, 3, 4)
x2 <- 2 * x1
y <- 3 * x1 + 4 * x2 + rnorm(4)

# Create a data frame
data_perfect <- data.frame(x1, x2, y)

# Fit a linear regression model
model_perfect <- lm(y ~ x1 + x2, data = data_perfect)

# Display the summary of the regression
summary(model_perfect)
```
